67

68

69

in 2-complement, the unsigned number divided by two plus one becomes the smallest possible negative signed number of the corresponding type

These tests imply two's-complement, but it's the only binary representation we support, see test/sanitytest.c...

Precision and width.

%d%d

Test excessively big number. Should fail

Replace testutil output routines. We do this to eliminate possible sources of BIO error

This works out as long as caller doesn't use any "fancy" formats. But we are caller's caller, and test_str_eq is the only one called, and it uses only "%s", which is not "fancy"...

www.openssl.org/source/license.html

License

internal/numbers.h

testutil.h

testutil/output.h

%%%s.%d%s

%%%s%s

/* %d%d */ { \"%s\"

, \"%s\"

test %d format=|%s| exp=|%s|, ret=|%s|

},\n

{\n

},\n

%f\n

-expected

t use any "fancy" formats. * But we are caller

%s

fancy

0xffffffffffffffffU,

0xffffffffffffffffU,

0x8000000000000000U,

0x8000000000000000U,
